trans-unit.source: Sample and Split
trans-unit.target: Sample and Split

trans-unit.source: Data Transformation / Sample and Split
trans-unit.target: Data Transformation / Sample and Split

trans-unit.source: These modules help you perform the data partitioning and sampling tasks that are critical in machine learning.
trans-unit.target: These modules help you perform the data partitioning and sampling tasks that are critical in machine learning.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Use a portion of a dataset for training, and some for testing
trans-unit.target: Use a portion of a dataset for training, and some for testing

trans-unit.source: Filter the input dataset to use only part of the data, by applying regular expressions or other conditions on column values
trans-unit.target: Filter the input dataset to use only part of the data, by applying regular expressions or other conditions on column values

trans-unit.source: Divide the input into multiple datasets by ratio or by using a stratified sample
trans-unit.target: Divide the input into multiple datasets by ratio or by using a stratified sample

trans-unit.source: When to Use Split vs. Partition and Sample
trans-unit.target: When to Use Split vs. Partition and Sample

trans-unit.source: If you need to decide how to divide your data and which tool to use, here are some simple guidelines:
trans-unit.target: If you need to decide how to divide your data and which tool to use, here are some simple guidelines:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> module: Produces exactly two splits of the data.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> module: Produces exactly two splits of the data.

trans-unit.source: However, you can specify the condition on which the data is split, and the proportion of the data to put into each subset.
trans-unit.target: However, you can specify the condition on which the data is split, and the proportion of the data to put into each subset.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> always saves the subset of data that doesn’t meet the conditions.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> always saves the subset of data that doesn’t meet the conditions.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> module: Gives you only the specified subset.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> module: Gives you only the specified subset.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you have a CSV file that contains customer features that you’d like to partition by using the value of a column, such as <userInputLocalizable>Country/Region</userInputLocalizable>.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you have a CSV file that contains customer features that you’d like to partition by using the value of a column, such as <userInputLocalizable>Country/Region</userInputLocalizable>.

trans-unit.source: You can easily divide the data in Azure Machine Learning Studio by using <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link>, and specifying a relative expression.
trans-unit.target: You can easily divide the data in Azure Machine Learning Studio by using <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link>, and specifying a relative expression.

trans-unit.source: Let's suppose your dataset covers multiple countries and regions, and you want to create separate datasets for each.
trans-unit.target: Let's suppose your dataset covers multiple countries and regions, and you want to create separate datasets for each.

trans-unit.source: One way to do this with <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> is to use multiple successive instances of <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> modules, one per country/region.
trans-unit.target: One way to do this with <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> is to use multiple successive instances of <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Split</link> modules, one per country/region.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> provides many more options.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> provides many more options.

trans-unit.source: It can generate a number of partitions that you specify, not only two, and it can perform other operations, such as sampling.
trans-unit.target: It can generate a number of partitions that you specify, not only two, and it can perform other operations, such as sampling.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> can also take only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows of a dataset, which is useful when you want to run short trials of a workflow.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link> can also take only the first <legacyItalic>n</legacyItalic> rows of a dataset, which is useful when you want to run short trials of a workflow.

trans-unit.source: For any kind of sampling or partitioning of data when you don’t need to keep all the data, you should use <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link>.
trans-unit.target: For any kind of sampling or partitioning of data when you don’t need to keep all the data, you should use <link xlink:href="a8726e34-1b3e-4515-b59a-3e4a475654b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Partition and Sample</link>.

trans-unit.source: List of Modules
trans-unit.target: List of Modules

trans-unit.source: The Sample and Split category includes the following modules:
trans-unit.target: The Sample and Split category includes the following modules:

trans-unit.source: Module
trans-unit.target: Module

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Creates multiple partitions of a dataset based on sampling
trans-unit.target: Creates multiple partitions of a dataset based on sampling

trans-unit.source: Partitions the rows of a dataset into two distinct sets
trans-unit.target: Partitions the rows of a dataset into two distinct sets

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you might find these related modules useful:
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you might find these related modules useful:

trans-unit.source: Increases the number of rare cases in a sample, or rebalances the cases for some target value
trans-unit.target: Increases the number of rare cases in a sample, or rebalances the cases for some target value

trans-unit.source: Performs dimensionality reduction
trans-unit.target: Performs dimensionality reduction

trans-unit.source: These modules create compact features from counts.
trans-unit.target: These modules create compact features from counts.
